definition: to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect?
sentences.chinese: 难道他们的不信，就废掉神的信吗。

sentences.english: Sleeping until mid-afternoon can ruin an entire day.
sentences.chinese: 一觉睡到中午会废掉一整天。

sentences.english: And if what was fading away came with glory, how much greater is theglory of that which lasts!
sentences.chinese: 若那废掉的有荣光，这长存的就更有荣光了。

sentences.english: She spoiled three sheets to write a letter.
sentences.chinese: 她写一封信废掉了三张纸。

sentences.english: Kudos to Japan on scrapping this 'giant turtle'.
sentences.chinese: 谢天谢地日本废掉了这只“巨龟”。

definition: to dismiss from office/to ban/to reject
an execution/to put sb to death
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste
to snub/to consign to the trash heap of history
to commit suicide on the orders of a sovereign (old)
